DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Wolfhound_Textfield=[22592]Debuting as a prototype design first field tested by the Kell Hounds and Wolf's Dragoons mercenary commands in 3028, the Lyran-made Wolfhound is regarded as one of the greatest light 'Mechs ever produced by the Steiner military. As a 'laserboat' with plenty of armor and speed, the Wolfhound is ideal for quick strikes.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_WS_VincentMK.42_Textfield=[22593]Desperation and the threat of violence can be the mother of invention. Surrounded by hostile factions, the Hegemony Armed Forces recognized the pressing need for a small craft that packed a punch to patrol the entry points to the Hegemony worlds that could obstruct the advancement of any invaders. These concerns eventually birthed the Vincent-class Corvette in 2432, replacing several outdated units, notably the Bonaventure and Vigilant. The Vincent remained in service with the SLDF until the Exodus. The Clan upgrade of the Vincent, designation Mk 42, differs only slightly from the Star League's original design, boasting a lithium-fusion battery system that enables it to make two jumps in short order and Clan HarJel hull-sealing technology.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Executioner_Textfield=[22594]Despite all fielded Executioner variants being relatively new, the prototypes of the Executioner have roots tracing back to early OmniMech production. The Inner Sphere codename for this 'Mech is the Gladiator, earned through its dominating stature over other 'Mechs. The Executioner carries a MASC, which grants it an extreme but temporary boost to mobility. When against opposing 'Mechs, the Executioner lives up to its name with incredibly precise long-range firepower. However, the Executioner does have some glaring weaknesses, such as a lack of close-range firepower and a lack of smaller backup weapons, which makes it difficult to effectively handle smaller targets.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Stormcrow_Textfield=[22595]Developed in 2930, this 'Mech was dubbed Ryōken, or "Hunting Dog," by House Kuritan intelligence agencies after its first use in the invasion. The designs for the Stormcrow quickly proliferated throughout the Clans, resulting in it being a common sight among almost every deployed force. The Stormcrow is an ideal all-rounder pick for a medium 'Mech, as it can outgun or outrun any of its opponents with good armor, speed, and firepower.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_DropShips_Textfield=[22596]DropShips form the first link in the chain of interstellar travel. These esteemed craft transport 'Mechs, vehicles, troops, and materiel from orbit to planetary battlefields. DropShips mount heavy arsenals, which make them equally devastating on land, in the atmosphere, and space. For this reason, DropShips rank as the most prized assets of any military force. In the Inner Sphere, DropShip designs remained virtually unaltered since the Star League era. With their superior aerospace and BattleMech technologies, the Clans provided the impetus to refit and innovate new designs to complement the Clan's unique combat doctrines.  The design and production of new military DropShips and upgrading existing designs became vital, primarily because these versatile crafts can be utilized in various combat and logistical roles.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_DS_Broadsword_Textfield=[22597]During the past seventy years, the Broadsword class DropShip has supplanted the aging Leopard as the favored BattleMech transport in several Clans. The Broadsword possesses superior weaponry, maneuverability, and armor but lacks the Leopard's integral fighter support. The first Broadsword was launched from the Marshall yards in 2979 and, within ten years, had found a home in the toumans of most Clans. Today, the Steel Vipers possess the most significant number of Broadswords in any Clan. The Broadswords arsenal includes several extended-range weapons that keep most threats at bay.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Enforcer_Header=[22598]ENFORCER

DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Executioner_Header=[22600]EXECUTIONER
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Viper_Textfield=[22601]Early in the invasion, the Viper earned the name Dragonfly from Inner Sphere forces. Boasting more jump jets than almost any other mech encountered, the Viper was quick, maneuverable, and could soar over battlefields. Despite decent armor for a 'Mech this size, all that movement does not come freely. The Viper significantly lacks firepower compared to other 'Mechs of similar weight and even some lighter 'Mechs. Regardless, it is still capable of effective hit-and-run tactics against slower, unsuspecting Inner Sphere targets.

DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_BattleMaster_Textfield=[22608]First built for the Star League in 2633 by Hollis Industries, the BattleMaster is one of the most iconic chassis of its time. Given its pedigree many tales of its operational record have circulated, from holding off entire lances to taking out multiple outposts single-handedly. As a well-rounded heavy-hitter with a storied past, the BattleMaster is considered a premiere assault 'Mech and a devastating force to reckon with on the field.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Locust_Textfield=[22609]First created in 2499, the Locust is still one of the most common BattleMechs in operation over five centuries later. While several more advanced light 'Mechs have been created over the years, few can match the Locust's combination of speed, endurance, and, perhaps most of all, very low cost. This has lead to a significant number of variants for the venerable scout, though often the extra armaments come at the cost of reducing its armor.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Banshee_Textfield=[22610]First fielded by the Terran Hegemony in the mid-25th century, the Banshee was originally intended to fulfill a close-combat role. However, poor performance on the battlefield relegated it to militia and training commands throughout the Inner Sphere. It was only until the start of the Third Succession War that necessity brought the chassis back into active service. Despite its shaky beginnings, the Banshee is respectably regarded as an effective direct-fire slugger capable of outmaneuvering many other 'Mechs in its class.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Thunderbolt_Textfield=[22611]First produced in 2491, the Thunderbolt - or T-Bolt as it is affectionately known - is a familiar sight throughout the Inner Sphere. One of the first 'Mechs designed for planetary assaults, it is renowned for its thick armor and heavy firepower. Though later superseded by larger and more advanced designs, the Thunderbolt's excellent design and fearsome reputation has kept it in production.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Highlander_Textfield=[22612]First produced in 2592, the Highlander served the Star League Defense Forces with distinction for almost two centuries, and earned its place in the history books with an absolutely stellar combat record. Designed to stand alone in the defense of a city, or to provide support for a mixed type attack, the Highlander makes up for its slow speed with the ability to leap over obstacles. When the Gauss Rifle fell out of use during the technological decline of the post-Star League era, many Highlanders were forced to downgrade their main weapon to an autocannon, though some occasionally sport PPCs.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_MistLynx_Textfield=[22613]First produced in 2926, the Mist Lynx is one of the oldest models on the field and a staple light 'Mech among Clan Smoke Jaguar. Known as Koshi, or "Small Death," by House Kurita, the Mist Lynx is a force to be reckoned with due to its extreme mobility and offensive power. This mobility comes with a price; the Mist Lynx is quite frail when it finds itself pinned down.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Adder_Textfield=[22614]First produced in 3010, the Adder was designed with the specific purpose of invading the Inner Sphere. Despite starting as a Clan Star Adder exclusive model, the Adder was so powerful every Clan sought it and it became a commonly used light 'Mech across all Clans. The Inner Sphere's codename for this 'Mech is Puma for its decisive ambush potential. The Adder is a well-armored, slow combat light that is best known for its iconic Prime configuration of 2 ER PPCs, which offer it precise and devastating long-range damage potential.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Dervish_Textfield=[22615]First released in 2520, the Dervish was one of the first BattleMechs to be produced in abundant numbers. Its primary role is that of a long range fire support platform, and its array of secondary weapons and jump jets make it highly mobile and menacing at any range. The trade-off to all this firepower, predictably, is relatively weak armor and a cooling system incapable of keeping up with sustained fire for long.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_WolfsDragoons_Textfield=[22616]Formed by order of the Grand Council to act as an advanced reconnaissance unit, the Dragoons were tasked with infiltrating the Inner sphere and gathering information under the guise of common mercenaries. Their standing order was to serve each of the Successor States and report on each nation's combat readiness should the Council green light a full-scale invasion. For years, the Dragoons reported directly to the Grand Council, until around 3019, their communications went dark. Khan Kerlin Ward of Clan Wolf insisted they followed his direct orders to report to him. Afterward, reports from the Dragoons became increasingly sporadic until they inexplicably stopped altogether after Kerlin Ward's retirement in 3029.<cf><cf>The Dragoons were formed by mostly freeborn and a small contingent of Trueborn volunteer warriors from Clan Wolf. The unit was specially trained by Clan Goliath Scorpion's famed Heartvenom Cluster for the assignment. Despite their mostly freebirth upbringing, upon arriving at the Inner Sphere in 3005, they quickly earned a reputation as one of the most elite mercenary units to serve in the late Succession Wars. One Bloodnamed Trueborn among their ranks, Natasha Kerensky, would become the most skilled MechWarrior in the Inner Sphere. The exploits of Kerensky and her Black Widow company became known far and wide throughout all of human-inhabited space.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Longbow_Textfield=[22617]From 2480 and never truly being phased out, the Longbow is one of the most recognizable fire support 'Mechs in the Inner Sphere. Well known for its staggering missile array, the 'Mech may not be very exciting or enticing for the pilot, but the oppressive presence it brings on the battlefield is never one to be overlooked. Despite this power, the Longbow does have a staggering weakness in its critical lack of armor.

DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Marauder_Textfield=[22630]Hailed as a pinnacle of BattleMech design when it was unveiled in 2819, the Marauder was one of the first 'Mechs to step away from the purely humanoid body type and embrace a more menacing appearance. The 'Mech quickly became popular as a command vehicle, and throughout the Succession Wars many battalion and regimental commanders made their Marauders second homes on the battlefield. Often deployed in heavy shock units with Warhammers and Thunderbolts, the Marauder is known for laying down an impressive long-range barrage before its opponents can close the distance.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_HistoryOfTheClans_Textfield=[22631]Humanity has expanded to the stars. And brought all their problems with them. It has now been over 900 years since mankind left the confines of Earth to colonize the vastness of space. Nearly 300 years since the specter of war led our ancestors into exodus. And nearly 250 years since the formation of Kerensky’s Clans. <cf><cf>Despite the infinite expanse of space and the vast riches of the universe, the remembrance imparts to us one absolute truth: War is inevitable. And that when it comes, the Children of Kerensky must be vigilant to ensure that the darkest impulses of humanity are never repeated again. It is a truth that we must accept with every fiber of our being if we are to one day return home and take back what was lost.<cf><cf>Loremaster Edmund Hoyt - Clan Smoke Jaguar
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_TheInnerSphere_Header=[22632]INNER SPHERE
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_InnerSphereAerospaceFighters_Header=[22633]INNER SPHERE AEROSPACE FIGHTERS
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_InnerSphereBattlemechs_Header=[22634]INNER SPHERE BATTLEMECHS
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_InternalSecurityForce_Header=[22635]INTERNAL SECURITY FORCE
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_JS_Invader_Header=[22636]INVADER
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_TheTerranExoduses_Textfield=[22637]In 2102, the Terran Alliance would set into motion one of humanity's greatest endeavors, the Deimos Project, a scientific call to build and test a device capable of faster-than-light travel. On the 28th of August, 2107, a small automated craft traveled to the Terran system's nadir point and successfully executed humanity's first hyperspace "jump" out of the Terran system. Over a year later, the TAS-Pathfinder became the first manned mission to explore an exoplanet within the Tau Ceti system, twelve light years from Terra. By 2116, the first successful colonization mission to Tau Ceti became humanity's first outpost outside the Terran system. Mankind had become a galactic civilization.<cf><cf>Over the next 280 years, a gold rush of unparalleled scale would see every Terran nation, culture, and faith set out to carve out their own place in an ever-expanding universe. Soon Terra, the cradle of humanity, would become a distant memory as centuries of colonization would see over 2000 new worlds and star empires rise over a 550-light year radius from Terra. This region of human-colonized space would become known as the Inner Sphere.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_WS_Texas_Textfield=[22638]In 2618, the SLDF was disappointed to find its aging Monsoon Class battle-ships consistently outperformed by the crafts of its member states. This produced immense frustration and a desire for change to remedy this underwhelming performance. The SLDF commissioned the creation of a new battleship, one that would utilize technological breakthroughs that had taken place during the 250 years since the Monsoon's inception. This spawned the massively armored WarShip, designated Texas. Krester Ship Construction received the contract for the new design, and work began in late 2616, with requests for this new craft to have increased speed and maneuverability, attributes Krester Ship had successfully implemented into the Kimagure Class pursuit cruiser. The Texas was activated in 2618. It saw extensive action due to the war in the wake of the Aramis Coup. Despite boasting superior offensive capabilities and armor, few vessels survived the conflict, with only seven of the original Texas vessels departing with the exodus fleet.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Javelin_Textfield=[22639]In 2751 Stormvanger Assemblies introduced the Javelin as a recon 'Mech with the firepower to survive being spotted. By the opening shots of the First Succession War,the Javelin had not yet been fully integrated into most regiments, but centuries of warfare have proven reliability of the design. Despite the destruction of its only production facility the Javelin remains a popular 'Mech, especially in the regiments of House Davion. It has gained a reputation as a versatile and mobile 'Mech that can appear almost out of nowhere, giving rise to the aphorism 'sneaky as a Javelin.'
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_ThePentagonCivilWar_Textfield=[22640]In 2801, that unity would shatter after Aleksandr’s death. Although the Great Father named his son Nicholas as his heir, most of the factions that arose on the Pentagon Worlds refused to follow his lead. Preferring leaders who shared their cultural upbringing. Infighting over who would now lead the Pentagon Worlds after Aleksandr’s death spread like wildfire, engulfing each system in the same shortsighted conflicts the Great Father had left the Inner Sphere to avoid.<cf><cf>And so, just like his father, Nicholas led his supporters and those who shared his father's dream into a second exodus. Nicholas felt dejection at the selfishness and greed of those who once followed him and his father into the void, hoping to build a new life. In a dark mirror of what happened in the Inner Sphere, Nicholas' departure was all that was needed to plunge all of the Pentagon Worlds into full-scale civil war.<cf><cf>The refusal of the Pentagon Worlds to put aside their former allegiances and band together under his father’s dream was a harsh lesson for Nicholas. A lesson that tempered the younger Kerensky into believing that a more radical solution must be considered if humanity was to truly free itself of the terrestrial tribalism his father fled home to avoid.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_TenthAlshainRegulars_Textfield=[22641]In 3034, most of the Rasalhague Military District broke from the Combine and became the Free Rasalhague Republic. This action came as a shock to many. Most of all, the Rasalhague Regulars. A native unit of the RMD remained loyal to House Kurita and the Draconis Combine. Unwilling to see their homeland given away to people they once branded terrorists, the Rasalhague Regulars rebelled and attempted to reclaim the Republic in the name of the Combine. But this action was not sanctioned by the Combine. Refusing stand-down orders from Gunji-no-Kanrei Theodore Kurita, the DCMS was forced to intervene and bring the "ronin" Regulars to heel. After the end of the Ronin War, the Rasalhague Regulars were dismantled. Their entire roster was arrested and held to military tribunals for refusing a direct order from the DCMS' chain of command. Those soldiers who survived this purge of disloyal ronin were eventually given pardons and reformed into the Alshain Regulars.<cf><cf>After a pitiful performance in the War of 3039, their unit's commander, Tai-shu Hassid Ricol, led them through a fierce training regimen to whip them into shape. As a result, a decade after the war, the Ashlain Regulars ranked as a ruthless and powerful unit in the DCMS despite their apparent youth compared to local units. Their position at the crux of Rasalhague, Lyran, and Kuritan space left them in a constant state of readiness. With the memories of Rasalhague and the Ronin War still fresh in the minds of many of the Alshain's veteran MechWarriors, there is an overall sentiment within the unit that many would rather die than see themselves lose their homes once more. They now rally to the call of "Death Before Retreat.”
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Jagermech_Textfield=[22642]In reviewing the limited success of the Rifleman, Kallon engineers agreed the 'Mech was under-armored, lacking in ammunition, and prone to overheating. Using these observations to design the JagerMech they tried to keep the best of the Rifleman while addressing its key deficiencies. Two out of three isn't bad. They were able to reduce the ammunition problem and all but eliminate the Rifleman's heat burden, but there was simply no way to increase the 'Mech's armor protection and retain the same weapons profile. Procurement officers were impressed with the design anyway, and the JagerMech began production in 2774.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_BlackKnight_Textfield=[22643]In the years since its introduction in 2578 the Black Knight has gained a positive and well-deserved reputation. With its creation, some believe that Kong Interstellar Corporation came close to achieving the ultimate in heavy-class BattleMech design. Production of the chassis slowed after the destruction of the KIC plants during the First Succession War, but the hallowed reputation of the Black Knight has only grown as a result.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Rifleman_Textfield=[22644]Initially conceived as a medium fire-support platform, chronic overheating problems plagued the Rifleman following its debut in 2505. A later version corrected only some of the issues, and in 2770 Kallon unveiled the heavier RFL-3N Rifleman. Twin autocannons and large lasers provide long range firepower at the cost of armor, particularly in the rear.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Quickdraw_Textfield=[22645]Intended as a replacement for the Rifleman when it was introduced in 2779, the original Quickdraw never supplanted it. Over the course of the Succession Wars however, the Quickdraw nonetheless earned the respect of MechWarriors and a place in every major military. A maneuverable machine capable of out-jumping most other heavy 'Mechs, it suffers from thin armor and heat dissipation problems in protracted engagements.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_ClanNovaCat_Textfield=[22646]Intensely spiritual and putting a high degree of faith in their mystics and Oathmasters, Clan Nova Cat allows their movements to be guided by the visions of their leaders and advisors. Much to the confusion and chagrin of other Clans, the Nova Cats and their spiritual way of life often led them to follow paths different from those of the rest of the Clans. The writings of Khan Sandra Rosse, known as the "Ways of Seeing," and the Right of the Vision, often involved prolonged periods of fasting, self-isolation, and meditation to achieve guidance on matters of great significance to the Clan.<cf><cf>The Nova Cats have long sat in the Crusader camp among Clans. However, their goals aimed to expand and exploit new worlds rather than conquer them. Despite their unique goals and strange ways, their support of the Crusader cause is enough for them to find quick allies across all the Crusader Clans save Clan Smoke Jaguar. The two Clans harboring a deep-seated blood feud stemming from the relationship and fallout of Nova Cat Khan Sandra Rosse and Smoke Jaguar saKhan Liam Ismiril.<cf><cf>Clan Nova Cats, unlike other Clans, gave their lower castes a surprising amount of freedom. As long as each caste fulfilled their duty and broke no laws, they could act and move as they pleased. Through careful stockpiling and offerings, the Nova Cat merchant caste reintroduced the concept of trading with other Clans. With a cautious approach and guidance, the fair exchange of goods between Clans without bloodshed or trials was again possible.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Hunchback_Textfield=[22647]Introduced in 2572, the Hunchback is a medium-to-short-range brawler that rose to prominence during the many urban battles of the Reunification War. Widely known for its street-fighting abilities, the Hunchback soon earned the respect and admiration of many MechWarriors. Though the original Komiyaba/Nissan General Industries factories were destroyed during the Succession Wars, Kali Yama acquired the rights to the design and soon began producing the Hunchback for the Free Worlds League.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Wolverine_Textfield=[22648]Introduced in 2575 as the newly-created Star League Defense Force prepared for inevitable conflict with the Periphery realms, the Wolverine was produced in prodigious numbers. Conceived as a heavy scout capable of undertaking assignments too hazardous for lighter 'Mechs, the Wolverine has served with distinction throughout the Inner Sphere.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_KingCrab_Textfield=[22649]Introduced in 2743 near the twilight of the Star League, the King Crab fulfilled General Kerensky's order for an assault 'Mech able to cripple or destroy another BattleMech in one overwhelming salvo. Though not sporting as much armor as other assault 'Mechs, the firepower mounted by the original King Crab and its successors admirably fulfills the role for which the 'Mech was designed.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_TheSuccessionWars_Textfiled=[22650]It only took two years for Kerensky to be proven right. In December of 2786, Minoru Kurita of the Draconis Combine declared himself First Lord of the Star League and attempted to claim the beleaguered worlds of the Terran Hegemony.  In response, all four other Great House Lords quickly followed suit, kicking off one of human history's most devastating and consequential wars.<cf><cf>For the next 250 years, the five so-called “Successor States” used every weapon available to them to scour the Inner Sphere in ceaseless war. Burning entire cities in nuclear fire, using chemical weapons to render the atmospheres of entire worlds uninhabitable and, in the case of House Kurita, systematically murdering the fifty-two million inhabitants of Kentares for daring to oppose Kurita’s occupation of the Davion world. All in the name of laying claim to the still vacant throne of the Star League.<cf><cf>When Wolf’s Dragoons arrived in the Inner Sphere in 3005 and reported their findings to the Clan Grand Council, the Succession Wars had pulled humanity into a new dark age. With billions of lives lost, hundreds of systems rendered uninhabitable, and humanity sliding into technological regression, many of the Star League's greatest achievements were dubbed “Lost Technology.” Or, as the spheroids call it, lostech.

DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_JumpShips_Header=[22656]JUMPSHIPS
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_JumpShips_Textfield=[22657]JumpShips provide the only means of transportation between the distant systems of the Inner Sphere, Periphery, and beyond. These vessels were constructed with the ability to make interstellar leaps of up to 30 light years at a time by harnessing the radiant energy of the stars with their tremendous solar-energy sails and Kearny-Fuchida hyperdrive technology. JumpShips are utilized mainly to transport fusion-powered DropShips, the favored method for interplanetary travel amongst all inhabited systems. In most cases, JumpShip designs can be traced back to the Star League era and utilize technologies far beyond the Inner Sphere states - a fact that has held for centuries, the most prominent being one coined lostech. For hundreds of years, JumpShips were spared the dangers of war; the armies of the Great Houses of the Inner Sphere resisted attacking these vessels out of respect for their inherent value as lostech.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_InnerSphereAerospaceFighters_Textfield=[22658]Just as the Inner Sphere had struggled to maintain their current and create new BattleMechs, the effort to hold on to their aerospace technology was a dwindling success. The Houses hesitated to deploy aerospace forces on all but the most critical missions as the technology required to repair and rebuild them was more advanced than BattleMechs.

DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_ClanGhostBear_Textfield=[22662]Known for their conservative nature and powerful sense of family, the Ghost Bears are considered to be among the most patient of Clans. Like the Strana Mechty Ghost Bear from which they derive their namesake, the Bears revel in patiently observing their prey, waiting for the perfect moment to strike. But when ready, the Ghost Bear attacks with unparalleled speed and ferocity, giving their target no chance to retaliate. This attitude extends not just to their war doctrine but also to the Bear's everyday life.<cf><cf>They will often silently hear all sides of any political debate, waiting for the opportune time to throw their substantial weight into any decision. This conservative attitude means the Bears are rarely goaded into giving up an advantage and will often emerge from disputes better off than their adversary. Over the centuries, this has made them a military and political powerhouse within Clan society.<cf><cf>However, the Bear's temperance can be viewed by outsiders as indecision, as the Bears are a political oddity among the Clans. Much of their rank and file more closely identify as Wardens, while their leadership has historically been devout Crusaders. The Bears themselves famously led the last major push to end the Great Debate, which resulted in the creation of Wolf's Dragoons.

DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_JS_Merchant_Textfield=[22669]Launched in 2503, the Merchant is the mainstay of the Inner Sphere trading fleets, visible at most Jump points. The vessel boasts a versatile design, with many units serving as military craft. But like most JumpShips, it is virtually unarmed, which makes it vulnerable to any enemy assaults, made even worse given that it is commonly equipped with only light armor. The Merchant was constructed with a few anti-meteor weapons but nothing with enough firepower to inflict significant damage on another craft.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_ClanOmniFighter_Textfield=[22670]Like the OmniMech design, the Clans wanted their aerospace fighters to be modular to allow rapid swaps of entire components. Whether for repairs or changing equipment to better suit the operation, an OmniFighter could be disassembled and reassembled within hours, giving it an unparalleled edge in versatility.

DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_JS_Scout_Textfield=[22678]Measured at 273 meters, the Scout is the smallest JumpShip in rotation by the Great Houses of the Inner Sphere. Befitting its name, the Scout was designed as an independent reconnaissance and exploration craft. The Scout's lack of size is compensated in other areas, as its faint emergence signature made it an invaluable asset during covert operations such as transporting small surgical strike teams trapped deep behind enemy lines. While this diminutive craft would not dispose of opponents in the flash of a laser, it could be relied upon to gather valuable intel that could be weaponized against any foe.<cf><cf>While the craft's small size makes it an ideal recon/stealth insertion craft, this comes at the expense of a smaller-than-average DropShip docking collar. This limits the number of DropShips that can dock and safely transport by the craft.

DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_DS_Vengeance_Textfield=[22681]Not only are the vessels of the Vengeance class the most colossal dedicated fighter carriers known, but they are also arguably the most lethal in use by the Successor States. The Fury's forty-fighter compliment lets it turn most targets into dust in minutes. A Vengeance-equipped force is virtually guaranteed the edge in battle over any opponent, even the formidable Clan Warships. The Vengeance Class vessels are almost always accompanied by an escort of DropShips, underscoring the value of its aerospace assets.

DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Aero_Shilone_Textfield=[22685]One of the few crafts designed after the beginning of the First Succession War, the Shilone became a staple of Kuritan medium aerospace fighters. Easily recognizable for its broad and almost flat design, the Shilone carried a heavy armor and weapon package that allowed it to excel against slower targets such as dropships and ground forces. Due to its creation occurring after the Succession Wars began, the Shilone is rarely seen outside Kuritan deployments but not unheard of.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Grasshopper_Textfield=[22686]Originally a rush job intended for both overt and covert operations on Terra, difficulties integrating several stealth systems delayed the chassis until after the climatic end of the Amaris Coup. With necessity longer a driving force, its stealth systems were stripped out and the somewhat unorthodox chassis began its distribution to the regular army. Capable of leaping over difficult terrain and able to sustain long operations with minimal resupply, the Grasshopper is still found in the armies of most Houses, despite its factory being abandoned during the second Succession War.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Awesome_Textfield=[22687]Originally built for the Star League in 2665, the Awesome's design was based on the aging STR-2C Striker 'Mech. While not as swift as its ancestor, it is not uncommon for BattleMechs to retire the field outright rather than face a formation of Awesome's. It excels at heavy engagements and is often tasked with securing the most critical objectives, or at least with guarding such objectives from the enemy.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Victor_Textfield=[22688]Originally built under a defense contract with the Terran Hegemony in 2510, the Victor was conceived as a support 'Mech with jump capabilities. It went went on to serve the Star League Defense Forces during the bloody Reunification War, and the design was later made available to the League's member states. While highly mobile for an assault 'Mech, and mounting a formidable AC20, it lacks long range firepower.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Flea_Textfield=[22689]Originally called the Trooper at its announcement in 2475, a cascade of flaws prompted a name change in an effort to avoid bad press when the Flea finally rolled off the line. While not exceptionally fast and possessing unimpressive combat capabilities, the Flea has the virtue of being exceptionally cheap and, given its extremely small size, frustratingly hard to hit.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Panther_Textfield=[22690]Originally conceived and designed as a fire-support vehicle for reconnaissance units, the prototype Panther was first built for the Star League in 2739. After the disastrous Battle of St. John in 2759, the Star League re-evaluated the design, replacing its large laser with a PPC. Slow for its size, but well-armored and known to hit hard, it's a great support unit for other 'Mechs.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Commando_Textfield=[22691]Originally designed by Coventry Metal Works to compete against other popular light 'Mechs of the era, the Commando is a slightly heavier scout easily capable of handling any other recon units may encounter. Impressed by its capabilities, the Lyran Commonwealth commissioned the Commando into service in 2486 for its exclusive use, employing whatever bureaucratic and diplomatic tools were needed to keep the chassis out its enemies hands.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Stalker_Textfield=[22692]Originally designed by Triad Technologies in 2594, the Stalker has been a workhorse assault 'Mech of the Inner Sphere for more than two hundred years, and served with distinction in the Star League Defense Forces for two centuries prior to that. The Stalker is a powerhouse of a 'Mech, mounting a mix of heavy weaponry and heavy armor. While no one will ever accuse the Stalker of being fast, few will claim it is easy to stop.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Raven_Textfield=[22693]Originally prototyped in 3024, the Raven is the result of a Capellan research and development program. The Raven was a bold attempt to recreate the sophisticated electronic warfare technology of the long-lost Star League era. Though a technical success, the prototypes met with mixed results and many were subsequently refit with more weapons instead of the expensive electronic suites, giving it a surprising amount of firepower for a light 'Mech.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_ThePeriphery_Textfield=[22694]Outside of the Inner Sphere and its Houses, the Periphery is a loosely mapped region of space that separates the Inner Sphere from the vast unknowns of the Milky Way. The Inner Sphere often looks down upon the regions and territories of the Periphery as lawless states that prioritize their freedom above the general well-being of their people.<cf><cf>The Periphery varies heavily in population density, with most of the large colonies existing on planets or in systems that are resource-rich and can thus sustain a booming economy by exporting to the Inner Sphere. Areas lacking in resources or other redeeming qualities are often barren, leading to Periphery colonies being few and far between. These large and empty swathes of space make ideal nesting sites for pirates and other fugitives looking to set their bases of operation as far from the law or prying eyes as possible.<cf><cf>Many Periphery states exist in isolation compared to the Inner Sphere, as most cannot afford the initial price and upkeep of faster-than-light communication. Technological advancements in medicine, agriculture, warfare, and more are also slow to arrive in these fringe reaches of space, making them slow to keep up with the Successor States.

DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_PheonixHawk_Header=[22696]PHOENIX HAWK
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Centurion_Textfield=[22697]Produced initially from 2801 until the main plant on Ramen II was destroyed in 2845, the Centurion was designed and built by Corean Enterprises as an operating partner for the already successful Trebuchet. After supplying a steady stream of spare parts to AFFS line units for nearly 150 years, and buoyed by the success and warm reception of the design as a whole, Corean built a secondary manufacturing facility on New Avalon in 3012. The Centurion represents a well-rounded combat platform in its tonnage range and is known for making slow, steady advances while being tough enough to absorb considerable punishment.

DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_SantandersKillers_Textfield=[22714]Santander's Killers are a unique breed of pirate in the Inner Sphere. With a command of mostly mutinied officers from the Federated Suns, Santander's Killers earned the reputation of assassins, raiders, and kidnappers under their self-styled Pirate King, Helmar Valasek. Unusually brutal and unafraid to get their hands dirty, the Killers slowly built their army by raiding military storage stations in the Draconis Combine. Any forces they lost on raids were replaced by more valuable equipment they stole from the Dragon.<cf><cf>Where other pirate bands would target valuables and items they could sell during their raids, Santander's Killers would primarily target supply depots of conventional resources they could use for their gain. Food supplies, 'Mech and vehicle parts, and water were among their most prized targets. These prized assets would go much further in their remote reaches of the Periphery than anything they could sell on a black market.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Orion_Textfield=[22715]Sometimes called 'a poor man's Atlas', the Orion is nonetheless a venerable, general-duty heavy 'Mech. Secured into legend as the 'Mech in which Aleksandr Kerensky stormed Amaris's last defenses on Terra, the Orion is one of the best known 'Mechs in history. Commissioned by the Terran Hegemony 2456 as a response to the increasing improvements to 'Mech designs used by other Houses, the Orion is nearly half a millennium old. Mounting over fourteen tons of armor and a weapons load leaning toward ballistic options, the Orion is a hardy 'Mech capable of dealing and sustaining a great deal of punishment.

DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_ClanSmokeJaguar_Textfield=[22730]Taking pride in both their namesake and their Clan's reputation of unparalleled ferocity, by the early 3040s Smoke Jaguar had risen to become the single most powerful Clan operating in the Kerensky Cluster. Considered the principal torch bearers of the Crusader political philosophy, it was the Smoke Jaguars, and through their Jade Falcon and Ghost Bear kin in the Crusader cause, who championed the Crusader's political positions in the Great Debate, inching the Clans ever closer to invasion.<cf><cf>Their unparalleled ferocity has left few Clans willing to challenge the Jaguar's wrath openly without using political alliances from other Clans. But this position of power often emboldens the Jaguars to bend and stretch the Clan's laws and traditions to their benefit, as the Wolves dared to claim when they lost the plans to the Dire Wolf assault 'Mech in a Trial of Possession with the Jaguars. But as the Jaguars would later claim, they uphold the laws of the Clans "to the letter." It is not their fault that their rivals have failed to account for or capitalize on such direct interpretations of their laws.<cf><cf>This attitude has won the Jaguars few friends among the other Clans, the least of which are the Warden Clans, who the Jaguars collectively despise. However, as the principal Clan championing the Crusader cause, the Jaguars share a mutual respect with Clans of comparable strength who share the Jaguar's hardline Crusader views, such as Jade Falcon and Ghost Bears. All three Clans are often quick to support one another politically in furthering the Crusader cause.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_362ndAssaultCluster_Textfield=[22731]The 362nd Assault Cluster was formed as the strong arm of Clan Smoke Jaguar’s Beta Galaxy. There was no action Beta Galaxy took without considering the status and disposition of the 362nd. Through careful bidding and decades of training and preparation, the 362nd is almost guaranteed to be present in almost every major campaign the Jaguars participate in. However, this prestigious position within the Jaguar touman comes with a large expectation for anyone serving in the 362nd. Competition within the cluster is fierce, and failure often comes at a much higher cost. But those that do accel within the cluster are often considered among the Clan's ristars.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_WS_BlackLion_TextField=[22732]The Black Lion was activated for service by the SLDF in 2691. This battlecruiser was a hefty piece of engineering, weighing in at a staggering 800,000 tons. The craft boasted swift mobility, allowing the Black Lion to outmaneuver most transports capable of 2.5 Gs of acceleration, giving it attributes that would be the envy of any ship. The size and complexity of the ship's drive system made it difficult to maintain, diminishing its military value to a degree. Despite their shortcomings, the Black Lions' tremendous speed, armaments, and armor made them an ideal and popular choice for head Naval battle groups.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Blackjack_Textfield=[22733]The Blackjack was born from a Star League mandate in 2757 for the creation of a new BattleMech 'with insurgency suppression and fire-support capabilities.' Despite fulfilling its production requirements and performing well in initial tests, the Blackjack unfairly developed a bad reputation and was all but rejected by the Star League. While its original design suits the Blackjack for engagement against lighter opponents, its range and sustained fire capability can make it a highly effective threat in the right hands.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Cataphract_Textfield=[22734]The Capellan Confederation found itself desperately short of heavy and assault BattleMechs during the final years of the Third Succession War. The Cataphract was born directly from that need. Pride quickly turned to embarrassment as the sole Cataphract production facility was lost to Davion forces only a few years after it became operational in 3025, and shortly thereafter the Cataphract could be found among the ranks of enemy garrison units. At first glance the Cataphract seems to be an attempt to make a heavy BattleMech as versatile as possible, given its mix of weaponry and an abundance of armor.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_ClanGrandCouncil_Textfield=[22735]The Clan Grand Council is the supreme governing body of the Clans that both enacts and enforces laws that govern all of Clan society. Convening only when necessary, each Clan is represented by the Clan Khan and saKhan to vote on the most severe matters impacting all of Clan space. The most prominent vote of the Grand Council will be selecting an ilKhan, an elected representative from one Clan chosen by a majority vote in the Council to preside over all Clans in times of war or great strife. During this time, the ilKhan is expected, but not required by law, to relinquish their role as Khan of their home Clan and lead over all Clans equally. All but a few ilKhans have succeeded in this regard.<cf><cf>The Grand Council has strict rulings that it may not convene for a vote on domestic matters of a Clan. Only when an issue grows to impact more than one Clan can it be brought before the Council. Individual plaintiffs can request to have their matter heard by the Grand Council, though they will only be accepted if the case is deemed of high enough stature. Warrior cases are the most common, while civilian matters are much rarer and are almost always rejected.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_DraconisCombine_Textfield=[22736]The Draconis Combine was the third Successor State founded of the five, a totalitarian dictatorship that passes the mantle of leadership generationally. The Combine has a vast range of cultures within its territorial borders. Still, a substantial amount of their ethnic majority and societal leadership trace their cultural roots back to the Japanese regions of Terra. Although smaller minorities of Muslim, African, and Scandinavian cultures still make up a portion of the Combine's civilian population.<cf><cf>Unlike the other Houses, the Draconis Combine maintains a reputation for ruling its people through a rigorous caste system. Fierce and traditional, the Draconis Combine bases most of their cultural norms and laws on a modern adaptation of the Bushido codes of Japan's Edo period. This heavily emphasizes their nobility and military might, headed by their modern-day samurai, MechWarriors. Despite profound ideological differences, their military leadership, proud ideology, emphasis on honor, and strict adherence to the law draw heavy parallels to our own Clan cultures and traditions.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_HatamotoChi_Textfield=[22737]The Federated Suns units that encountered this new 'Mech were confused, mistaking it for a Charger. As the war of 3039 progressed, it became clear that the Hatamoto-Chi, the first 'Mech in the Hatamoto chassis line, was something entirely different. Clearly matching the capabilities of the old Star League era Thug Battlemech, it appears that the Hatamoto-Chi still came from the Charger mold, likely because it was just easier and faster to use the already running Charger assembly line. It does so to its benefit too, retaining the ease to repair that's one of the Chargers few praise points, as well as removing at least some of the stigma surrounding that old maligned design.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_DS_Fury_Textfield=[22738]The Fury is one of the smallest DropShips operated by the Successor State militaries. It is capable of delivering four Infantry platoons and eight light Combat Vehicles onto the battlefield. Owing to its light weapons array, the Fury must operate in concert with better-armed DropShips like the Gazelle armor transport and Leopard fighter carrier to be effective. Although ill-suited to the task, it is often used for raids and planetary assaults because larger vessels are deemed too valuable to risk, rendering the Fury a disposable asset.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Gargoyle_Textfield=[22739]The Gargoyle, also known as the Man O' War to the Inner Sphere, is still a commonly used 'Mech throughout the invasion. As an inverse to the role one would normally see in an assault 'Mech, the Gargoyle charges into battle with extreme speed and lacks firepower for a 'Mech of its size. Able to take the brunt of enemy attacks and yet carry the speed of a medium or heavy 'Mech to lead the charge, the Gargoyle sits in a strange place on the invasion roster. Its weaponry is akin to a medium 'Mech, and it carries almost all of its weapons in its arms, making it a liability in extended fights due to the ease of stripping off its weapons. Due to these drawbacks and smaller 'Mechs being able to achieve similar goals, there are speculations about whether the Gargoyle is worth the cost of such a large platform. Regardless of these reservations, the Gargoyle is a common sight during the invasion.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_TheInnerSphere_Textfield=[22740]The Inner Sphere is the region of space in which all the Great Houses and their factions reside. One thousand light years in diameter with Terra at the center, the Inner Sphere is trapped in a never-ending cycle of conflict, shifting borders, and endless expansionism to regain the throne. Each House and faction vies for its station, constantly at the expense of another. Although relative stability has returned to the Inner Sphere, after centuries of Succession Wars displaying the worst of humanity's impulses, the Inner Sphere is a fraction of its former glory. With many worlds rendered uninhabitable and the rest reeling from centuries of perpetual conflict.<cf><cf>The Inner Sphere is currently divided into five primary territories. The Federated Commonwealth, a massive juggernaut combining the economic and military might of a unified House Davion and House Steiner. The Draconis Combine, led by House Kurita, is a fierce totalitarian dictatorship emphasizing honor and military might. The Free Worlds League is a parliamentary republic that operates more as a union of many smaller territories bound together by a central parliament led but not owned by House Marik. The Capellan Confederation, a struggling police state led by House Liao, is currently reeling from the Fourth Succession War that saw half their territory lost. The Free Rasalhague Republic is a constitutional democracy and the largest independent state not associated with the Great Houses.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_ShadowCat_Textfield=[22741]The Inner Sphere never gave the Shadow Cat a code name. No pilot that encountered one survived, and no record escaped the planet it deployed on. ComStar later learned of the 'Mech and its actual clan name, which ended with both sides knowing it as the Shadow Cat. The Shadow Cat was mainly deployed in the later stages of the invasion despite being produced in 3003 by Clan Nova Cat. It continued to serve as a steadfast 'Mech choice long after the invasion despite numerous attempts to class it out and replace it. A unique feature of the Shadow Cat is the MASC equipped on this 'Mech, allowing short bursts of extreme speed to gain on enemies or flee from hostile areas.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_InternalSecurityForce_Textfield=[22742]The Internal Security Force operates as the leading intelligence agency and enforcement arm of the Draconis Combine. The ISF's nature grants the Draconis Combine its reputation as a restrictive dictatorship that will do anything to preserve its hold on power. Through brute force, public indoctrination, and espionage into rival factions, the ISF proactively monitors all potential threats to the Dragon from both external and internal threats to the Combine and the Kuritan royal family. Eliminating them when necessary.<cf><cf>Members of the ISF go through nothing short of indoctrination and brainwashing to mold them into the perfect spies to complete their mission. Instilled with a belief that it is the destiny of House Kurita to one day rule over all of humanity, ISF agents will gladly lay their lives on the line to prove their loyalty to the cause. Their deaths are another step to push the Combine towards its rightfully earned mantle over the Inner Sphere. Every mission, no matter shocking or appalling, is for the benefit of the House and will be done in the name of the Coordinator.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_JS_Invader_Textfield=[22743]The Invader is the most common JumpShip used by the Successor States and Kerensky's Clans. Initially launching in 2631, the versatile craft generated success, gaining popularity with both military units and commercial users. The Invader is one of the few outdated Inner Sphere designs whose original Inner Sphere defense system boasts offensive capabilities, giving it some much-needed firepower to ward off threats.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Kintaro_Textfield=[22744]The Kintaro was originally designed in 2587 as a frontline unit designed to deliver Narc missile beacons for ally forces. With the loss of the last known Narc factory in 2792, the Kintaro became simply another missile platform, and lead eventually to the production of the downgraded KTO-18 by the Federated Suns. Whatever the variant, the Kintaro is still a tough frontline 'Mech capable of delivering an impressive salvo of missiles for a 'Mech of its size.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_KitFox_Textfield=[22745]The Kit Fox is a Clan Cloud Cobra design and no Smoke Jaguar plants produce it, making Kit Fox a rare sight in their roster. When first encountered by Inner Sphere forces, its effectiveness earned Kit Fox the codename Uller, after the Norse God of Archery. While most Clan light ‘Mechs prioritize speed and mobility for scouting, the Kit Fox is a rarer breed. Only moving at 97.2 KPH, the Kit Fox is a slow combat light that focuses on support with a dizzying array of long-range firepower. Each Kit Fox configuration prepares weapons for any engagement, from long-range fire to close-quarters combat against any target unlucky enough to close.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_DS_Leopard_Textfield=[22746]The Leopard' Mech transport has served The Inner Sphere combat units since the dawn of the Star League. For centuries, it has been the most common 'Mech carrier in active service throughout the Inner Sphere. This craft is well-suited for raiding expeditions, it's 18,00 tons able to transport a lance of BattleMechs together with a pair of aerospace fighters. Leopards are often utilized to provide support for planetary assaults. The vessel can quickly drop in 'Mechs to plug in breeches in a defensive position or provide extra firepower for a crucial assault. The Leopard's offensive capabilities consist primarily of energy weapons, although a trio of LRM launchers provides additional ranged fire. The nose weapons bay is outfitted with a pair of PPCs, an LRM-20, and three medium lasers.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_WS_Liberator_TextField=[22747]The Liberator is a refitted design derived from the SLDF's outdated Avatar-Class heavy cruiser, dating back to 2531. Although avatars were considered obsolete by the era's standards, General Kerensky opted to take these vessels with the exodus fleet, with their superior cargo storage and DropShip capacities deemed of high value. The Avatars were mothballed when the fleet arrived on the Pentagon worlds. They remained in storage until the 31st century, when the Clans began upgrading from their cache fleets in preparation for their invasion of the Inner Sphere. Clan techs went to work and upgraded the Avatar's weapons and armor, morphing into the Liberator, outfitting the cruiser with superior armor and clan weaponry without sacrificing its massive cargo facility.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Aero_Lightning_Textfield=[22748]The Lightning is among the oldest aerospace fighters deployed, with early prototypes dating over 200 years before the collapse of the Star League in 2511. While more modern variants of the Lightning have increased the weapon capacity along with the armor totals, the core design of the Lightning remains the same: moderate firepower with extreme speed. The range capacity of the Lightning leaves much to be desired. Still, the fighter's high speeds covered that gap by granting it brutal hit-and-run capabilities.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Mauler_Textfield=[22749]The Mauler technically began its life as the Daboku, originally deployed along the Draconis Combine border in 3038. Codenamed the Mauler by Federated Commonwealth forces, the 'Mech was an utter embarrassment for Kurita and a death trap for any MechWarrior unlucky enough to be saddled with it. When the chassis was redesigned in the 3040's the choice was made to adopt the Mauler codename as its official moniker, mostly in an effort to avoid the stigma of its previous failures. The Mauler's extreme-range weapons allow it to inflict serious damage before most enemy weapons are even in range.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_JS_Monolith_Textfield=[22750]The Monolith is the largest non-combat JumpShip ever constructed. It is the most expensive craft available, with 750 meters of engineering prowess on full display. Due to its unparalleled value, the Monolith is only operated by the militaries of the Successor States and Clans. It is said that most of the Clan Monoliths were built above the Pentagon Worlds or Kerensky Cluster because only a handful were produced before the departure of the SLDF. Although they possess different origins, few variances exist between the Inner Sphere and Clan vessels.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Nightstar_Textfield=[22751]The Nightstar was born in the early years of the Amaris Civil War when it became clear that battlefield commanders, especially those piloting Marauders, were being specifically targeted by Amaris troops. Eight months after the SLDF commissioned this heavy support and command 'Mech, the first Nightstars were put into production in 2767. Following Kerensky's Exodus it became an early casualty of the First Succession War, with both of its production facilities being destroyed in 2786. A pair of Gauss Rifles supplemented with an ERPPC give it unprecedented long-range capabilities.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_Otomo_Textfield=[22752]The Otomo serves as the royal guard for House Kurita. Found on Luthien defending the Unity Palace, the Otomo has the singular priority of protecting the members of House Kurita. Regardless of the plight of the Combine, the Otomo only departs Luthien to serve as a guard for a member of the royal family. Like the Genyosha, the Otomo are granted any supplies they may need to complete their duty regardless of logistics or strategic concerns.<cf><cf>MechWarriors invited to join the Otomo have earned the highest honor the Draconis Combine can bestow. They are entrusted with the safety of the Kuritan royal family and, with it, the fate of the Combine itself. To join the Otomo, one must prove not only their skill but their dedication to the Dragon as well.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Cyclops_Textfield=[22753]The Star League Defense Force requested an assault platform able to perform in swift, mobile offensives assisting the commanders of its regular army units. Engineers eventually debuted the Cyclops in 2710 and designed it to be part of a command unit. Unfortunately, the Cyclops suffers from the mindset that the BattleMech would have ample supplies and supporting units at its disposal. No one anticipated the carnage of the Succession Wars, and the extent to which it would strip the military's capabilities to support its BattleMech regiments.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Vulcan_Textfield=[22754]The Star League Defense Force's push into the Rim World's Republic-occupied Terran Hegemony proved a need for an effective anti-infantry 'Mech. Bitter close quarters fighting on city streets meant the League was losing 'Mechs to Republic infantry. The SLDF quickly fielded queries to manufactuers for a new 'Mech to solve their problem. In 2777, MatherTechno answered with the Vulcan. Its armament and armor are designed for combat against infantry, and it's effective there, but means it comes up lacking against 'Mechs its own size. The Vulcan is at least highly mobile and presents a narrow silhouette, earning it the nickname 'Scarecrow'.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_WS_Essex_TextField=[22755]The Star League Essex class destroyer entered service in 2711, created as a replacement for the Naga, Baron, and Carson Class WarShips, which had been unremarkable and left a lot to be desired. The Essex proved swift and reliable, seeing extensive combat, notably in the Periphery. The Essex's durable construction enabled it to absorb a substantial amount of punishment compared to other destroyers in the era. Although its offensive capabilities did not match the newer Inner Sphere or Clan designs, its firepower and reliability surpassed most destroyer arsenals of the time.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_TimberWolf_Textfield=[22756]The Timber Wolf was released in 2945 by Clan Wolf and the secrets of its production remain closely guarded. Every Timber Wolf seen outside of its home Clan was acquired as salvage, a gift, or as part of a deal. Stories say many parts of the 'Mech are built by hand, a testament to its quality and craftsmanship. The Timber Wolf was nothing short of an impossible feat in the eyes of the Inner Sphere defenses that first encountered it, further proving the quality of its design. Due to the appearance of a hybrid of the Marauder and Catapult ‘Mechs ComStar gave the Timber Wolf the codename Mad Cat. One of the most well-known Clan ‘Mechs, the Timber Wolf symbolizes everything the invading Clans aimed to achieve on the battlefield. Fast, dominating, and impenetrable.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Warhawk_Textfield=[22757]The Warhawk is an assault design aiming to take a very precise approach to its engagements. Developed by Clan Smoke Jaguar in 2999, the Warhawk is a semi-maneuverable assault well known for the 4 ER PPCs that allow it to wreak havoc from a distance. Almost all Warhawk configurations are seen with a Targeting Computer to enhance their accuracy at range to bolster its lethality. Due to the success of the chassis, Clan Smoke Jaguar carefully ensures that the designs for this 'Mech never fall into the hands of any rival Clans. All Warhawks seen outside of Clan Smoke Jaguar forces are either stolen or salvaged. The Warhawk was codenamed Masakari upon first contact with House Kurita, naming it after a medieval battle ax.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_TheClans_Textfield=[22758]The descendants of General Aleksandr Kerensky and the 80% of the original Star League Defense Force that followed him into exile, the Clans are a collective civilization that roots their values in their historic ties to the SLDF and their radical caste-based society that promotes military merit above all. The Clans are an oddity in that they are both a collective organization under the supreme governing body of the Clan Grand Council and its elected ilKhan and individual Clan entities with their independent leadership that often confront one another directly.<cf><cf>A warrior culture with a strict caste system segments Clan society based on their societal roles within the Clan. The life of a Clan citizen can be rigid and unforgiving. Clan society escapes the shackles of hereditary inheritance or generational wealth that plagues much of the Inner Sphere, but alternatively strives to reward those who contribute to the betterment of their society. Instead, there is a unique social divide between Trueborns, genetic decedents of the Clan's founders artificially engineered by the science caste, and freeborns, naturally born humans born outside the Clan's rigorous eugenics program. With individuals that carry the carefully curated genes of the various Trueborn Bloodhouses often seen as superior to those of freeborn heritage.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_DS_Union_Textfield=[22759]The first Star League Union Class vessels were constructed in 2708. A large number of these craft left the Inner Sphere in the Exodus, serving the followers of Kerensky well during the long journey to the Pentagon and the exploration of the Kerensky Cluster.  Many of these Unions were mothballed during the demobilization that occurred following 2787 and, therefore, survived the Exodus Civil War. <cf><cf>Although many Union Class vessels were reactivated to transport materials to and from the new colonies in the Kerensky Cluster, it became apparent that The Union was not well-suited to the reorganized Clan military. In light of this, engineers endeavored to re-design the craft. Today, much like their Inner Sphere counterparts, Unions are one of the most common DropShips. They leveraged a wide variety of roles as both 'Mech carriers for the Warrior caste and purely logistical crafts ferrying needed goods between star systems servicing all branches of the lower castes.<cf><cf>The first Clan-style Union left the new shipyards at Strana Mechty in May 2829. This new and improved model of the Union could transport a complete OmniMech Trinary and was better armed and armored than its predecessor. However, it sacrificed mobility and weighed in at 4,000 tons. The Union's arsenal boasts mainly laser weapons, most of which utilize highly accurate pulse technology.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_BA_Elemental=[22760]The goal of the Clan eugenics program is to curate and guide the evolution of the Clan's trueborn warriors, generation by generation, to make warriors more perfectly attuned to the battlefield role they are bred and trained to fulfill. There is no greater example of the program's success than those Trueborns bred for the Clans' infantry corps, the Elemental warriors. Hulking brutes with a physique that no natural human could hope to achieve; Elementals are trained for ground combat from birth, adding a fierce skillset to their perfect stature. To complete the complement of an Elemental is their battle armor. Clan Wolf first introduced Elemental battle armor, a technological wonder that allows a small group of ground soldiers to take on an opposing 'Mech and emerge victorious. While normal humans can successfully use Elemental battle armor, their armor is designed exclusively with Elementals in mind, and only they can bring it to its fullest potential.<cf><cf>The Elemental battle armor varies in equipment but always follows the core principle of a primary, secondary, and tertiary weapon. The primary gun varies from Small Lasers, Flamers, or 'Mech mounted Machine Guns. The mounting equipment for these weapons is very similar to OmniMechs, granting Elementals the ability to rapidly adjust their equipment based on their needs. The secondary weapon in the other arm is for anti-personnel armaments such as low-caliber machine guns or rifles. The tertiary weapon on an Elemental battle armor is almost always two dual missile racks on the rear shoulders. After firing, the pilot can eject the housings to improve mobility.<cf><cf>The standard Elemental battle armor weighs a tonne. A ferro steel endo skeleton driven by monomer artificial musculature enhances the wearer's natural strength, with over a quarter of that weight going into thick armored plating. This makes Elementals incredibly hardy, able to survive a direct hit from most 'Mech mounted weapons. The jump jets mounted provide extreme maneuverability. Even against powerful Clan' Mechs, a Star of suited Elementals can be a horrifying foe.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Corsair_Textfield=[22761]The long decline and loss of technology that arose from the centuries of warfare during the Succession Wars hit hardest in the Periphery. BattleMechs out there are not simply field-repaired. They are all too often mash-ups, with whole parts, including skeletons, grafted on in an effort to field equipment that can still fight. The largest of these 'FrankenMechs' are often also referred to as 'Corsairs'; desperate chop-shop heavy and assault BattleMechs forged from scraps of other 'Mechs, whatever can be found on the battlefield. This often results in a 'Mech as eclectic as it is formidable.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Cicada_Textfield=[22762]The original Cicada was designed by a small firm, HartfordCo, whose previous manufacturing experience had been confined to communications and targeting systems. Designed as a supplement or replacement for the popular Locust 'Mech, the Cicada found limited use by the Star League after its introduction in 2740. Although it was more expensive than the Locust, its increased mass gave it advantages that the Star League found useful. The Cicada's prime assets are its speed and its lack of ammunition concerns. Unfortunately, it only carries the armor of a 'Mech half its size.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_TheGoldenCentury_Textfield=[22763]The victory over the Pentagon Worlds only emboldened Kerensky to push further radical changes in his new society. As ilKhan, he ordered the creation of the Clan caste system, with the warrior caste acting as their leaders. He founded the tenets of the Clans' Laws and Honor Codes that established rules of engagement for settling disagreements between Clans and peers. He pushed his scientists to establish the Clan eugenics program and rigorous sibko training programs to better prepare the next generation for the challenges ahead.  By his death, his early followers had all become true believers in his vision of the Clans. They vowed to reinforce his established ideals even after his passing.<cf><cf>What followed was known to the Clans as the Golden Century.  An unprecedented century of peace, prosperity, and expansion saw the Clans colonize over thirty new worlds in the Kerensky Cluster and oversee huge technological advancements that eclipsed even the greatest advancements of the Star League.  Medical advancements that could regrow lost limbs, enhanced genetic modification and manipulation of the eugenic program's trueborn offspring, advanced infantry battle armor that would eventually become the Elemental suits, and Omni technology allowing for the ability to completely reconfigure 'Mech and Aerospace fighter equipment in less than an hour.<cf><cf>The Clans had finally accomplished General Aleksandr Kerensky’s vision of a society insulated from the greed and corruption that doomed the Inner Sphere. With their stability now ensured, the Clans looked outward at their grander place in the universe. And the Hidden Hope of the man they now called “The Great Father.”
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_DireWolf_Textfield=[22764]There is no 'Mech so feared as the Dire Wolf. At 100 tons, the Dire Wolf is a mobile weapons platform that the Inner Sphere did not imagine could exist. A slow, hulking brute originally designed by Clan Wolf and later taken by Clan Smoke Jaguar, the Dire Wolf foregoes all maneuverability and subtlety for nothing short of indiscriminate annihilation. The name Daishi, or "great death," was given to this 'Mech during the invasion by House Kuritan defenses. Even then, the code name falls short of its power.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Trebuchet_Textfield=[22765]Though initially carrying a blistering array of advanced technology due to its last-minute entry into the Star League Defense Force ranks in 2780, the Trebuchet was also one of the first BattleMechs that went back to the drawing board as a result of the Succession Wars. Redesigned using older technology so Corean Enterprises could continue to manufacture the chassis in an era defined by scarcity, the Trebuchet is a solid support 'Mech ideal meant for long-range bombardment.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Dragon_Textfield=[22766]Though originally designed for sale to the Star League, the Dragon was rejected by SLDF purchasing agents in favor of an upgraded version of the Shadow Hawk. Luthien Armor Works, amazed and angered by the rejection, pushed the Dragon into full production in 2754 and sold it to the Draconis Combine, where it would soon become their standard BattleMech. Today, the Dragon is easily the most prominent 'Mech in the Combine arsenal, known for its speed and packing enough ammunition to sustain long engagements.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_DS_Union_Header=[22767]UNION
DigitalExtras_StringTable::UI_MainMenu_Universe_Header=[22768]UNIVERSE
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_UrbanMech_Header=[22769]URBANMECH
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_FoundingOfTheClans_Textfield=[22770]Unlike his father, Nicholas Kerensky did not lead his people into uninhabited space. Instead, he chose a surveyed world far from the Pentagon Worlds with over a decade of colonization and seeding of terrestrial plant and wild life, Strana Mechty.  With his arrival, the small colony of fifty thousand people swelled to over a million inhabitants and Kerensky immediately got to work building his new society.<cf><cf>After six years of building and testing on Strana Mechty, Kerensky finally announced to his followers his intentions to forsake the terrestrial cultures and prejudices that humanity carried with them into the stars and instead build something new. A new society where the merits of the Star League and SLDF were revered as an ultimate ambition to bring humanity back into the shared unity it had lost. His Clans. Kerensky announced that he intended to form his Clans and train with the ultimate goal of returning to the Pentagon Worlds and, under his leadership as ilKhan, bringing those who spit in the face of his father’s legacy to justice.<cf><cf>This rallying cry galvanized Kerensky’s followers into binding themselves to Kerensky’s Clan ideals. As Nicholas carved out the tenets of their new society, the twenty Founding Clans began to train in preparation for their military campaign to retake the Pentagon Worlds. After gathering intelligence through Operation SABLE SUN, Kerensky planned to launch the Clan’s first joint military strike campaign, Operation KLONDIKE. All twenty of Kerensky’s clans simultaneously invaded all five Pentagon World.  The Clans took less than a year to bring the Pentagon Worlds to heel. Kerensky’s victory galvanized the tenets of the early Clan beliefs, and now, Kerensky’s true work could begin.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Jenner_Textfield=[22771]Unlike most other BattleMech designs before the 31st century the Jenner was a source of national pride for a single state. Designed, produced, and used solely by House Kurita in 2784, the Jenner became synonymous with the Draconis Combine. Later, the Jenner's prominent role in the Kentares Massacre would tarnish its reputation. Regardless, its speed, mobility, and firepower make it ideal for destroying enemy targets and scouts alike.
