DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Atlas_Textfield=[22784]When General Aleksandr Kerensky laid down the design specifications for the Atlas in 2755, he decreed it should be 'a 'Mech as powerful as possible, as impenetrable as possible, and as ugly and foreboding as conceivable, so that fear itself will be our ally.' The Atlas met those ambitions, and from its first deployments would grow a terrifying reputation. Heavily armored, heavily armed, and heavily feared, the Atlas is a lumbering monstrosity of firepower.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Catapult_Textfield=[22785]When Hollis Incorporated wanted to test the waters of the BattleMech industry, they did so with a completely new design and a state-of-the-art factory. They shipped out record numbers of Catapults for the three-year contract they had with the Terran Hegemony, but ceased production in 2563 when the contract was not renewed. Primarily a fire-support platform, the Catapult is often used in second line and specialist mountaineering regiments.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_MadDog_Textfield=[22786]When first seen by Inner Sphere forces, the Mad Dog was codenamed Vulture. It was believed that the 'Mech was designed to circle the battlefield with its long-range armament, waiting for a chance to strike. In reality, the use cases of the Mad Dog were far more aggressive. The purpose of the Mad Dog was to provide an endless barrage of long-range firepower to its enemies as it closed to deliver the final blow. Although it lacks some of the armor and staying power one would find in other heavy mechs, the firepower of the Mad Dog is not to be underestimated.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Summoner_Textfield=[22787]When first spotted by Inner Sphere 'Mech pilots, the Summoner was given the codename of Thor due to the prime configuration sporting a PPC and an LB 10-X AC, drawing the description of thunder and lightning. Among the oldest second-generation OmniMechs, the Summoner serves as a more maneuverable option compared to other heavy OmniMechs. Equipped with decent firepower, armor, and a hefty jump jet complement, the Summoner an ideal multipurpose 'Mech.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Crab_Textfield=[22788]When originally built for the Star League in 2719, the approach taken by Cosara Weaponries was to create a BattleMech that was easily maintained and well suited for high-endurance raiding far from supply lines. The Crab was seen by many as a reliable standby and the eventual standard for SLDF medium 'Mechs. The League's collapse orphaned the design, however, and the loss of ferro-fibrous armor production eventually led to centuries where the surviving units were downgraded to carry standard armor. Even still, the Crab's elegant simplicity practically assured that enough would survive to the present era.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Warhammer_Textfield=[22789]When the procurement officer outlined requirements for 'a mobile 'Mech with enough firepower to destroy or severely damage any 'Mech of the same weight class or lower', StarCorps Industries responded in 2515 with the aptly named Warhammer. Serving ably in the ranks of the Star League, the Warhammer formed the backbone of several heavy regiments. The Warhammer supplements its devastating long-range capabilities with a host of medium and short-range weapons.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Annihilator_Textfield=[22790]While ancient Star League records date the original Annihilator schematics to the final year of the Amaris Civil War in 2780, the chassis was never known to have actually entered production until it was seen among the ranks of the mysterious Wolf's Dragoons mercenary company in 3009. With a top speed of 32.4 km/h - making it one of the slowest 'Mechs ever designed - the Annihilator relies on massive amounts of armor to shrug off any fire directed its way. Together with its immense amount of firepower, the Annihilator more than lives up to its name.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Hatchetman_Textfield=[22791]While commissioned and produced by the Lyran Commonwealth starting in 3023, the Hatchetman design is rumored to have come from Team Banzai working at the NAIS in the Federated Suns. It's the first new 'Mech chassis seen in over a century, and the first to make use of a melee weapon: its namesake hatchet. The Hatchetman's current deployment in city garrisons has been a success, and has seen many enemies succumb to point blank ambushes of AC/10 fire and hatchet swings. This has led to plans for a greater deployment of the design, as well as rumors that the Federated Suns may be receiving shipments of the 'Mech in the future.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_PheonixHawk_Textfield=[22792]While commissioned and produced by the Lyran Commonwealth starting in 3023, the Hatchetman design is rumored to have come from Team Banzai working at the NAIS in the Federated Suns. It's the first new 'Mech chassis seen in over a century, and the first to make use of a melee weapon: its namesake hatchet. The Hatchetman's current deployment in city garrisons has been a success, and has seen many enemies succumb to point blank ambushes of AC/10 fire and hatchet swings. This has led to plans for a greater deployment of the design, as well as rumors that the Federated Suns may be receiving shipments of the 'Mech in the future.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Omnimechs_Textfield=[22793]While technology in the Inner Sphere degraded, the Clans experienced a golden age of advancement. Front of the line in their innovations were OmniMechs, highly adaptable and modular BattleMechs that allowed parts and components to be swapped effectively on a whim to meet any mission requirements. Where standard BattleMechs could take weeks or even months to repair or swap components or equipment, OmniMechs allowed for replacements such as swapping out an arm, leg, or torso in mere hours. The level of customization these 'Mechs offered was unthinkable to the Inner Sphere and just the tip of the iceberg in the vast technological advances the Clans carried over them.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Assassin_Textfield=[22794]While the development of the Assassin in 2676 was often considered the prime example of a political pork project, rife with exaggerated performance statistics, fudged budget estimates, and numerous (sometimes dangerous) corners cut during the production phase, the Assassin nonetheless turned out to be a surprisingly solid 'Mech. Though it possesses relatively lackluster firepower for its tonnage, the Assassin compensates with a high top speed and a decent amount of protection, making it ideal for hit-and-run tactics and in combat against lighter enemies.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Charger_Textfield=[22795]Widely regarded as Luthien Armor Works biggest failure, the CGR-1A1 Charger was conceived as an ultra-heavy recon unit. Released in 2665, its armament is laughable and the armor is enough for recon duty but lacking against any opponent near its own size. Being capable of spectacular speeds for its hulking frame is notable, but not enough to balance out against its faults and assignment to one is widely seen as a punishment. Further variants of the Charger manage to undo its shortcomings, but only by downgrading the 'Mech's top speed.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_Zeus_Textfield=[22796]With the collapse of the Star League in 2781 the stability of the past two centuries disappeared with it, and the status quo started to change dramatically. Seeking to prepare for this new political reality, the Lyran Commonwealth began work on a new assault 'Mech to bolster its forces. The first Zeus walked off the line in 2787, just in time for the outbreak of the First Succession War. Excellent heat dissipation and a variety of long-range weapons have ensured its presence in Lyran units ever since.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_OperationExodus_Textfield=[22797]With the death of House Cameron, a power vacuum emerged at the heart of the Star League’s High Council. In October 2780, the High Council would strip Kerensky of his title of “Protector,” intending to disenfranchise the one man who could stand in the Council Lords' way of furthering their ambitions. Kerensky knew that no matter who became the next First Lord of the Star League, they would eventually order the Star League Defense Force to pummel their rivals into submission.  Not wanting to see the SLDF used as a tool of oppression, Kerensky planned the unthinkable.<cf><cf>Confiding in his friend Jerome Blake, Kerensky outlined his plan to take the entirety of the SLDF into exile. Choosing to throw themselves into the void of uninhabited space over the prospect of becoming puppets to be wielded by the other House Lords.  Over 80% of the SLDF agreed to follow the Great Father into exile. And with the help of Jerome Blake and the Star League Department of Communications, Kerensky would, in secret, dismantle much of the SLDF’s infrastructure and take the vast majority of the Star League’s WarShips, ‘Mechs, and personnel into exile with him. On October 2nd, 2784, the Exodus fleet rendezvoused above New Samarkand and departed known human space, with humanity’s greatest peacekeepers disappearing from the Inner Sphere forever.<cf><cf>Although Kerensky hoped that removing the League's most advanced and deadly weapons would curb the Great Houses' darker ambitions, his better judgement knew that the Great Houses would stop at nothing to fight over the carcass of what was once mankind’s greatest achievement.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Lore_FreeRasalhagueRepublic_Textfield=[22798]With the formation of the Federated Commonwealth, the Draconis Combine found themselves surrounded on two fronts as both halves of the FedCom supernation now threatened to engulf the entirety of the Combine. Knowing that the FedCom war machine would next come for the Combine once they recovered from the recently concluded Fourth Succession War, Theodore Kurita, with the help of ComStar Primus Myndo Waterly, entered into a secret pact to save the Combine from annihilation. Part of that plan included supporting a successionist movement within the long-rebellious Rasalhague Military District and sponsoring their independence from the Combine. In 3034, the citizens of the Rasalhague Military District declared their independence from the Draconis Combine, forming a new independent nation. The Free Rasalhague Republic.<cf><cf>Despite Theodore Kurita, Archon Katrina Steiner, and the ComStar orders jointly supporting the formation of the Republic, many loyalists of both Kuritan and Steiner loyalties staged an armed, unsanctioned rebellion, seeking to reclaim Rasalhague worlds for their respective homes. Theodore Kurita went so far as to brand rebelling DCMS forces as ronin. Deploying the best of the DCMS to come to the aid of the infant nation's KungsArmé.<cf><cf>When the dust of the Ronin War settled, the Republic had survived, but not without consequences. The destruction at the hands of Steiner and Kurita loyalists during the war continues to enflame tensions with the Republic's neighbors. With their small loyalist military reeling from the war, the Republic has been forced to supplement their home-grown KungsArmé through extensive use of mercenary forces. This is something the common citizenry has grown to despise after several incidents involving mercenaries during the Ronin War resulted in extensive collateral damage and Rasalhageian fatalities during the war. Despite the common citizen's displeasure at their presence, the Rasalhague Republic's elected representatives vitally needs these outside forces to protect the republic from its much larger neighbors until they could rebuild the KungsArmé to stand against the AFFC and DCMS.
DigitalExtras_StringTable::Tro_Mech_MarauderII_Textfield=[22799]Wolf's Dragoons contacted Blackwell Industries in 3010 to take the already famed Marauder design, and turn it into a 100-ton Assault 'Mech. Working from existing plans meant for a short design phase with the Dragoon's Zeta Battalion having one among their ranks a little over 2 years later. Only minor changes from the original mean this 'Mech remains powerfully armed. Now sporting as much armor as an Atlas, and adding jump jets make this 'Mech a terrifying sight on the battlefield. Currently under exclusive contract with Wolf's Dragoons, many military units are clamoring for Blackwell to sell to the wider arms market. Although very rarely one can be spotted outside the Dragoon ranks.

KelCampaignEventStringTable::DLCHeroMech_StatusReport_StartsUnlocked_Content=[23486]스타 커맨더,<cf><cf>{MechChassisName} {HeroName} {MechVariantDesignation} 특별 버전 옴니메크가 귀하의 메크 베이에 도착했습니다.<cf><cf>"{HeroSkinName}" 커스텀 스킨과 {MechVariantDesignation} 옴니포드는 메크 연구실에서 이용할 수 있습니다.
KelCampaignEventStringTable::DLCHeroMech_StatusReport_Unlocked_Content=[23487]스타 커맨더, <cf><cf> 소유자 레벨 {HonorLevel}에 도달했기 때문에 {MechChassisName} {HeroName} {MechVariantDesignation}특별 버전 옴니메크를 사용할 수 있게 되었습니다. 도달 시점에서 메크 실험실에서 바로 사용하실 수 있습니다.
KelCampaignEventStringTable::TutorialPrompt_Simpod_Body=[23488]심포드는 가상 시뮬레이션에서 훈련할 수 있는 곳입니다.<cf><cf>캠페인에서 임무를 완료하면 심포드에서 사용할 수 있습니다. 연습, 경험치를 위해 임무를 다시 플레이하고 고급 임무 매개변수(AMP)를 완료할 수 있습니다. AMP를 완료하면 추가 XP 보상을 받습니다.<cf><cf>훈련 시뮬레이션에는 사격장과 전투 경기장이 포함됩니다. 두 곳 모두 메크 로드아웃을 쉽게 테스트할 수 있습니다.<cf><cf>오르두 모드에서는 당신과 당신의 스타가 끝없는 적의 물결에 맞서 싸웁니다. 캠페인을 진행하면서 이 모드의 더 어려운 버전을 사용할 수 있으며, 더 무거운 메크를 조종할 수 있습니다. 보상을 위해 고급 임무 매개변수를 완료하기 위해 도전하세요.<cf><cf>경기장 모드에서는 스타메이트와 직접 대결하여 기술을 테스트할 수 있습니다. 각 참가자의 팀을 포함하여 경기 매개변수를 설정할 수 있습니다. 모든 참가자는 관전을 선택할 수 있으며 AI로 교체할 수 있는 옵션이 있습니다. 캠페인을 진행할수록 더 많은 경기장 위치가 잠금 해제됩니다.

Marketing_StringTable_GB::Marketing_FlashStorm_Feature_Header=[23730]주요 특징
Marketing_StringTable_GB::Marketing_FlashStorm_Main_Description=[23731]레오 샤워스는 사망했습니다. 율릭 케렌스키가 교전 규칙을 변경하는 동안, 고스트 베어 클랜 칸 비욘 요르겐슨과 알레사 카브린스키는 테라를 향한 경쟁에서 선두를 차지하기 위해 다음 행보를 계획합니다. 고스트 베어의 힘을 증명하고 잃어버린 영광을 되찾는 정예 부대, 실버루트 케식을 지휘하세요. <cf><cf>강력한 에번 재규어와 나이트 자일 메크를 획득하기 위한 소유의 재판에 참여하세요. 메크 공장과 군함을 생산할 수 있는 궤도 조선소로 가득한 알샤인의 지배권을 놓고 전설적인 두 번째 빛의 검과 맞서 싸우세요. <cf><cf>이 스릴 넘치는 확장팩에서 4개의 새로운 옴니메크와 4개의 새로운 배틀메크를 해제하고, 엘리멘탈들을 지휘하며 우주와 그 너머까지 전투를 펼치세요!
Marketing_StringTable_GB::Marketing_FlashStorm_Features_Body=[23732]새로운 12개 미션 스토리 캠페인 – 실버루트 케식을 이끌고 고스트 베어의 명예를 회복하고 전장을 장악하기 위한 끊임없는 캠페인을 진행하세요. <cf><cf>4개의 새로운 옴니메크 – 나이트 자일, 에번 재규어, 파이어 모스, 헌츠맨, 모두 옴니포드를 완벽하게 커스터마이징할 수 있습니다. <cf><cf>4개의 새로운 배틀메크 – 전설적인 코디악, 제너 IIC, 헌치백 IIC, 라이플맨 IIC를 사용하세요. <cf><cf>확장된 메크 랩 – 엔진 교체를 포함한 향상된 커스터마이징 옵션으로 배틀멕을 미세하게 조정하세요. <cf><cf>엘리멘탈 – 스타 커맨더 루크는 스타를 지원하기 위해 엘리멘탈 첨병대를 지휘합니다. 제이드 팰컨과 스모크 재규어의 엘리멘탈 분대를 상대하면서 명령 휠을 사용하여 루크와 그의 첨병대를 지휘하세요. <cf><cf>진화된 전투 기능 – 고스트 베어 지휘선인 그리즐리의 선체에서 싸우고, 멕워리어 전투에서 강력한 신 보스인 아이언 탈론과 맞서며 가장 긴장감 넘치는 전투를 체험할 수 있습니다..
